original: Claeson, Knut Oskar Felix, fil. mag., läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 3/3/88 i Eksjö av garv. Andreas C. o. h. h. G. 26-37 m. leg. läk. Lisa Möller. Barn: Åke f. 26, Bengt 35. — Stud:ex. i Kalmar 08, stud. i Upps. 08, i Lund 16, fil. kand. 21, fil. mag. 24, skol-överstyr. lek- o. idr :kurs 29, vinter-idr :kurs 30, provår i Upps. 25. Res. t. Öland m. univ:stip. 10, nordl. Sv:e o. Norge 24, Tornedalen 28, Danm., Tyskl., Holl., Belg. o. Frankr. m. Bröd. Hultmarks reisestip. 32. E. o. ämneslär. i Värnamo 22, vik. adj. i Kristianstad 22, e. o. ämneslär. i Karlskoga 23, e. lär. i Luleå 23-25, e. lär. i Upps. 25, vik. adj. i Linköp. 25-33, adj. i geogr. o. biol. m. hälsolära v. Gbgs latin sed. 32. Bitr. led. v. skolungd. fjällfärd 31.
translated: Claeson, Knut Oskar Felix, BA, high school teacher, Gothenburg, b. 3/3/88 in Eksjö to tanner Andreas C. and his wife H.H. G. Married to certified physician Lisa Möller from 1926-1937. Children: Åke b. 1926, Bengt b. 1935. Education: High school diploma in Kalmar 1908, studied in Uppsala in 1908 and Lund in 1916. Bachelor of Arts in 1921, Master of Arts in 1924. Courses on school management and sports in 1929 and 1930. Practical year in Uppsala in 1925. Traveled to Öland on a university scholarship in 1910, Northern Sweden and Norway in 1924, Tornedalen in 1928, Denmark, Germany, the Netherlands, Belgium and France on Bröd. Hultmark's travel scholarship in 1932. Worked as a subject teacher in Värnamo from 1922, substitute teacher in Kristianstad in 1922, subject teacher in Karlskoga in 1923, teacher in Luleå from 1923-1925, teacher in Uppsala in 1925, substitute teacher in Linköping from 1925-1933, and geography and biology teacher with a focus on health education at Gothenburg's Latin School from 1932 onwards. Deputy member of the school youth expedition to the mountains in 1931.

employmentHistory.jobTitle: Geography and Biology Teacher with a Focus on Health Education
